list_definition.definition: a kind of plant whose young leaves are eaten as a vegetable

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He grows spinach in his garden.
We had steak and spinach for dinner.

list_ex_of_english: Common species of vegetables cultivated on the plots were tomato, spinach, potato, sweet potato and chillies.

Are we going to stamp eggs, or mark spinach, asparagus, and other things of the sort?
The leaves are cooked and used like spinach.
Moreover, carrots and spinach are also cultivated in this part of the farm.
The lysine-sensitive isoenzyme of aspartate kinase from spinach leaves has a subunit composition of 4 large and 4 small subunits.

Green leafy vegetables such as spinach are also rich in magnesium as they contain chlorophyll.
